isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS, BUMPER AND RUNNING BOARDS - MXT - REMOVE AND INSTALL - Rear Bumper, Tow Hooks, and Trailer Hitch

svcproc.title: Rear Bumper, Tow Hooks, and Trailer Hitch

svcsubproc.title: Rear Bumper and Tow Hooks - Removal

step1.para: On the driver's side remove the four nuts, washers and bolts (Item 2, Figure 46) securing the tow hook (Item 1, Figure 46) to the rear bumper (Item 3, Figure 46). Remove the tow hook.

caution.para: Support the rear bumper prior to Step 2 to prevent it falling.

step1.para: On the passenger side, repeat step 1. Remove the tow hook (Item 1, Figure 46) and the rear bumper (Item 3, Figure 46) from the vehicle.
Remove the two nuts, washers, and bolts (Item 1, Figure 47) securing the trailer hitch (Item 4, Figure 47) to the frame bracket (Item 2, Figure 47) on the driver side.
Repeat step 3 for the passenger side of the trailer hitch (Item 4, Figure 47). Remove the trailer hitch (Item 4, Figure 47) from the vehicle.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Bumper and Tow Hooks - Installation

step1.para: Install the trailer hitch (Item 4, Figure 47) to the driver and passenger side frame brackets (Item 2, Figure 47) with the mounting bolts, washers and nuts (Item 1, Figure 47).

Line up the rear bumper (Item 3, Figure 46) and the tow hooks (Item 1, Figure 46) with the holes in the frame and trailer hitch and secure with the eight mounting bolts, washers and nuts (Item 2, Figure 46).
